reference.title: Product Name Standard Document
reference.organization: Fleet Numerical Meteorology and Oceanography Center

entry.name: average
entry.description: Intermediate value calculated from data points whose contributions are equal, not necessarily one of the outcomes.

entry.name: accumulation
entry.description: Increase or growth by addition especially when continuous or repeated.

entry.name: maximum
entry.description: The greatest value.

entry.name: minimum
entry.description: The smallest value.

entry.name: end-begin difference
entry.description: The value at the end of the time range minus the value at the beginning.

entry.name: root mean square
entry.description: The square root of the average of the squares of a set of numbers.

entry.name: standard deviation temporal
entry.description: The positive square root of the temporal variance.

entry.name: covariance temporal
entry.description: A measure of the nature of the association between two random variables (temporal variance).

entry.name: begin-end difference
entry.description: The value at the beginning of the time range minus the value at the end.

entry.name: ratio
entry.description: The relationship between two or more things.

entry.name: standardized anomaly
entry.description: no description available.

entry.name: summation
entry.description: summation.

entry.name: reserved
entry.description: Reserved.

entry.name: reserved for local use
entry.description: Reserved for local use.

entry.name: difference high
entry.description: The difference between the weighted means of the values of two or more higher levels and the weighted means of the values of two or more lower levels.

entry.name: average weighted
entry.description: Intermediate value calculated from data points whose contributions are not equal, not necessarily one of the outcomes.

entry.name: quantile (percentiles)
entry.description: Dividing ordered data into q essentially equal-sized data subsets; the quantiles are data values marking the boundaries between consecutive subsets. Here q = 100 and is called percentiles. (Wikipedia)

entry.name: probability amoung the ensemble members
entry.description: the chance that an event will occur amoung the ensemble members.

entry.name: arithmetic average across all ensemble members
entry.description: An unweighted intermediate value across all ensemble members, not necessarily one of the outcomes.

entry.name: standard deviation of all ensemble members
entry.description: The positive square root of the variance of all ensemble members

entry.name: probability
entry.description: The chance that an event will occur

entry.name: missing
entry.description: Missing.
